document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the metallic species of Lasioglossum (Dialictus) in Canada (Hymenoptera, Halictidae, Halictini) 2591

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the metallic species of Lasioglossum (Dialictus) in Canada (Hymenoptera, Halictidae, Halictini) 2591

heading.emphasis:
Key to female metallic
Lasioglossum
of Canada

paragraph.keyLead: 2. Metasomal terga reddish brown to blackish or with metallic reflections ............................................................. 3

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4. Mandible of female
Dialictus
with subapical tooth (A) present, (B) absent, as indicated by arrow.

FIGURE 5. Gena of female
Dialictus
(A) narrower than eye, (B) wider than eye.
FIGURE 6. Dorsolateral angle of pronotum (A) obtuse, (B) acute.

FIGURE 7. Tegula of (A)
L. imbrex
(
tegulare
species group), (B)
L. oceanicum
.

paragraph.keyLead:
- Supraclypeal area very strongly convex ( Fig. 111D ); parapsidal lines very wide, greater than two puncture diameters ( Fig. 11B ) .....................................................................................................
L. foveolatum (Robertson)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8. Mesoscutal punctation on lateral portion of disc (A)
L. obscurum
, (B) L. incompletum .

FIGURE 9. Propodeum of (A)
L. hudsoniellum
, (B)
L. testaceum
.
FIGURE 10. Mesoscutal punctation (A) completely dense, (B) sparse medially (indicated by arrow).

FIGURE 12. Mesepisternum of female (A)
L. nigroviride
, (B)
L. oblongum
.
FIGURE 13. Declivitous surface of T1 with acarinarial fan (A) present, (B) absent.

FIGURE 14. Metapostnotum of female (A)
L. versans
, (B)
L. ruidosense
.

FIGURE 15. Gena of female (A)
L. zephyrum
, (B) L. packeri .

FIGURE 16. Protrochanter of (A) typical
Dialictus
, (B) female L. callidum .

FIGURE 17. Mandible of female (A)
L. coeruleum
, (B) L. callidum .

FIGURE 18. Mesepisternum of female (A)
L. atwoodi
, (B)
L. dreisbachi
, arrow indicates sharply delineated change in sculpture.
FIGURE 19. T1 acarinarial fan (A) complete, without dorsal opening, (B) incomplete, with dorsal opening.
FIGURE 20. Mesepisternum (A) tessellate-imbricate (B) rugose-rugulose.
FIGURE 21. T2 apical impressed area with punctures on medial portion, indicated by arrow, (A) present, (B) absent.
FIGURE 22. T3 and T4 with tomentum (A) absent, (B) present, arrows indicate apical fringes.

FIGURE 23. Metapostnotum of female (A)
L. oblongum
, (B)
L. planatum
.

FIGURE 24. Metapostnotum of female (A)
L. atwoodi
, (B) L. viridatum .

paragraph.keyLead:
- Protrochanters very wide, nearly as wide as long ( Fig. 16B ); dorsal margin of mandible strongly curved at midlength ( Fig. 17B ) .............................................................................................................
L. callidum (Sandhouse)

- Mesepisternum with a sharp delineation between coarsely rugose dorsal half and punctate-imbricate ventral half ( Fig. 18B ) ..........................................................................................................................
L. dreisbachi (Mitchell)

- Distal margin of clypeus 1.4–1.5 times wider than clypeal length, lateral margins appearing weakly convergent; apicolateral corner of clypeus acute ( Fig. 238C ) ...................................................................
L. weemsi (Mitchell)
